components.description: A Japanese onigiri, a cone-shaped ball of white rice, a snack wrapped with a sheet of nori, or seaweed.
components.title: Rice Ball

description: A Japanese onigiri, a cone-shaped ball of white rice, a snack wrapped with a sheet of nori, or seaweed.
title: Rice Ball

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A rice ball (called onigiri in Japanese)¬†containing white rice, and wrapped in seaweed (called nori in Japanase). Rice Ball was approved as  http://emojipedia.org/rice-ball/
emoji_net_data.name: rice ball

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00075445n: A type of Japanese food, consisting of vinegared rice, seafood and pickled vegetables. Its origin lies in the south-east asian technique of pickling fish in rice to preserve it.
A dish, based on Japanese cuisine, the chief ingredient of which is raw fish; sashimi.
Rice (with raw fish) wrapped in seaweed
Sushi is a Japanese food consisting of cooked combined with other, seafood, vegetables and sometimes tropical fruits.
Cooked rice combined with a slice of raw fish
A form of sushi consisting of rice topped with a variety of raw fish and vegetables or garnishes.
Regular sushi: a piece of raw fish (or other topping) on top of a small oblong brick of sticky white rice.

bn:00067718n: Annual or perennial rhizomatous marsh grasses; seed used for food; straw used for paper
Seeds of the rice plant (Oryza sativa) used as food.
The seeds of this plant used as food.
Rice is the seed of the monocot plants Oryza sativa or Oryza glaberrima.

bn:13602064n: A Japanese snack food made from white rice formed into a triangular or oval shape, usually with a filling.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
